abstract:
This paper questions various claims from the paper "Social distancing strategies for curbing the COVID-19 epidemic" by Kissler, Tedijanto, Lipsitch, and Grad: most importantly, the claim that China's "intense" distancing measures achieved only a 60% reduction in R0.
Competing Interest Statement
The authors have declared no competing interest.
Funding Statement
affiliations: National Science Foundation under grant 1913167 and by DFG Cluster of Excellence 2092 "CASA: Cyber Security in the Age of Large-Scale Adversaries"
author: Daniel J. Bernstein
title: Further analysis of the impact of distancing upon the COVID-19 pandemic

award-group.funding-source: Cyber Security in the Age of Large-Scale Adversaries"

funding.funding-statement: This work was supported by the U.S National Science Foundation under grant 1913167 and by DFG Cluster of Excellence 2092 "CASA: Cyber Security in the Age of Large-Scale Adversaries"
